channel.title: [Delta] Item.random help!
channel.description:
Okay, well I have an Item.random set up called [code=java]Item.randomBonfire[/code]
But, I also have items in this that I want there to be multiples of. I've tried everything I know how to do to make these items have multiples, but I just can't figure it out sadly. :(
NOTE: I know the following code only has 2 items in it, but it's just a test to get it started! Both items are stackable, so how do I make the rewards come in multiples?
Here's the code that I have for it. [code=java]public static int Bonfire[] = {7774, 7775};
public static int randomBonfire() { return Bonfire[(int)(Math.random()*Bonfire.length)]; [/code]
Lastly, could I possibly just use one of these codes? [code=java]addItem(7775, 25+misc.random(35)[/code]

item.title: [Delta] Item.random help!
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Okay, well I have an Item.random set up called

But, I also have items in this that I want there to be multiples of. I’ve tried everything I know how to do to make these items have multiples, but I just can’t figure it out sadly.

NOTE: I know the following code only has 2 items in it, but it’s just a test to get it started! Both items are stackable, so how do I make the rewards come in multiples?

Here’s the code that I have for it.

[code=java]public static int Bonfire[] = {7774, 7775};

    public static int randomBonfire()        
    {            
            return Bonfire[(int)(Math.random()*Bonfire.length)];        [/code]

Lastly, could I possibly just use one of these codes?

Read full topic
